plantuml_diagram:
@startuml
!define AWSPuml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/awslabs/aws-icons-for-plantuml/v20.0/dist
!include AWSPuml/AWSCommon.puml

node "AWS ECR\n(Container Registry)" as ecr
node "AWS ALB\n(Application Load Balancer)" as alb
node "Go Web App\n(net/http)" as goapp <<Go, net/http>>
database "AWS IAM\n(Credentials)" as iam
artifact "Docker Image" as dockerimg
cloud "Terraform\n(Infrastructure as Code)" as terraform

terraform --> ecr : Provisions
terraform --> alb : Provisions
terraform --> iam : Provisions

goapp --> iam : Uses credentials

dockerimg -down-> ecr : Stored in
alb -down-> goapp : Routes traffic to

ecr -down-> dockerimg : Pulls image

goapp -down-> dockerimg : Runs from
@enduml

architecture_description:
This architecture represents a Go-based web application deployed on AWS using containerization and infrastructure as code. The main components are:

- **Go Web App (net/http):** The core application, written in Go, using the standard net/http library to serve web requests. It is packaged as a Docker image.
- **Docker Image:** The Go web app is containerized for consistent deployment and scalability.
- **AWS ECR (Elastic Container Registry):** Stores the Docker image, making it available for deployment.
- **AWS ALB (Application Load Balancer):** Routes incoming HTTP(S) traffic to the running Go web app containers.
- **AWS IAM (Credentials):** Provides secure credentials and permissions for the application and infrastructure components.
- **Terraform:** Used for provisioning and managing AWS resources (ECR, ALB, IAM) as code, ensuring repeatable and auditable infrastructure changes.

**Relationships:**
- Terraform provisions ECR, ALB, and IAM resources.
- The Docker image is built and pushed to ECR, then pulled from ECR for deployment.
- The ALB routes external traffic to the Go web app containers.
- The Go web app uses IAM credentials for secure AWS access.
- The Go web app runs from the Docker image, which is stored in ECR.

This setup enables automated, secure, and scalable deployment of the Go web application on AWS.
